Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label a fish in a water environment.
The student can identify and include in the drawing the resources the fish needs to survive, such as water and food.
The student can depict other plants and animals that live in or around the water habitat of the fish.
The student can illustrate and label how the water habitat supports the needs of the fish and other living things.
The student can demonstrate the relationship between the fish and its environment by showing how parts of the habitat like plants and rocks are important for the fish's survival.
